content: Singaporean radio presenter (1938–2023) **Koh Sock May** (1938 − 1 October 2023), also known by her stage name **Si Di**, was a Singaporean radio presenter with news station [Capital 95.8FM](/wiki/Capital_95.8FM). Koh began her career in 1964 at [Rediffusion Singapore](/wiki/Rediffusion_Singapore). She was a member of the [Amoy Hokkien](/wiki/Amoy_dialect) drama play team, formed in 1957 by her husband Zhang Weiming. Also proficient in Mandarin, Koh worked for Rediffusion for near to 50 years. Koh died from [cancer](/wiki/Cancer) on 1 October 2023, at the age of 85. Her [wake](/wiki/Wake_(ceremony)) was held at the Singapore Casket from 1 October to 5 October 2023. She was cremated at the [Mandai Crematorium and Columbarium](/wiki/Mandai_Crematorium_and_Columbarium) on 5 October 2023, 10.45am local time. She had a daughter and a son. This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Koh Sock May
